alert.note: Alert for Somerset (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 18 at 9:31AM EST until December 19 at 3:24AM EST by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 445 PM EST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of northern New Jersey, including the following county, Somerset. * WHEN...Until 445 PM EST Monday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 929 AM EST, As a result of the 3 to 5 inches of rain that has fallen since last evening, there are several USGS river gauges above flood stage. Flooding will continue throughout the day. - For Lamington River at Burnt Mills: At 8:45am the stage was 12.76 feet. Flood Stage is 11 feet. ... For Middle Brook at Burnt Mills: At 9:00am the stage was 9.35 feet. Flood Stage is 9.5 feet. ... For North Branch Raritan River at North Branch: At 9:15am the stage was 14.96 feet. Flood Stage is 12.3 feet. ... For North Branch Raritan River at South Branch: At 9:00am the stage was 11.46 feet. Flood Stage is 8 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around...don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Move to higher ground now. Act quickly to protect your life. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
